Reviews.Title: “Great Location Lovely Guest House”
Reviews.Author: Westsussexgirl1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner in February 2012, the Guest House is lovely and well kept, Judy is extremley helpful, we arrived an hour early and she still checked us in and gave us our room and then as we had a late flight she advised we could leave our bags once checked out and collect them when we wre ready very handy as we had the whole day. The location is brilliant it is about 10min walk to the Colosseum and about 30mins into the centre with Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, the longest walk was the vatican which was around an hour, however there are buses and the metro but we opted to walk and see the sites on the way. It is like a bed and breakfast the staff aren't there all day just in the morning but they leave all the contact numbers should you need to contact them (we never needed to), the beds were comforatable and they made the bed and changed all the towls daily, I would highly recommend this hotel due to it's central location and the Inn was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Small Inn, Perfect Staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: robphys
Reviews.Content: THIS IS NOT A HOTEL!! please don't expect this, it is an unmanned Inn, I.E. you have a room and bathroom, but no staff in the place of residence during the day or night. If you are not happy with this then DO NOT STAY THERE!! So now that is out of the way, how do you find it. If, like we did, you come in by Leonardo express train (14 euro's one way and takes 32 minutes!) then the inn is VERY easy to get to. You walk down the left side of the train station to the Zebra crossing, then walk all the way towards the Church of Santa Maria Maggiore. If you are stood in front of the church, you will see two streets. You take the street that is on the right, as you walk look very closely at the LARGE doors. the second one you pass will have the Merulana on the 3rd floor. You will be met by Judy, who is Brilliant, extremely helpful (she spent most of a day ringing the airport trying to find our missing luggage!) and very good with local travel advice, restaurants, the best canoli's in town etc. The breakfast is very basic, but its a buffet continental breakfast with bacon and scrambled eggs. and thats it. VERY clean throughout, rooms cleaned and made daily. As for location, for us reasonably fit and active, it was a 10 minute walk to the Colosseum. We also walked from the Vatican through the center of Rome and back. But you are also located 10 minutes away from the Termini (train, Tram and Bus station) with the number 40 express taking you straight to the Vatican. Bus tours also leave the Santa Maria Maggiore every 15 minutes, this will enable you to hop on and off at all the major attractions. We came back from the Inn, on the 31st December 2011 and spent 4 nights there with absolutely no issues (inc Wi-Fi. we would recommend it. Negatives are that for many people who like to find the nooks and crannies of a city, it is a long way out from the hustle and bustle of the city......however for others this would be a positive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: This wonderful small "guest house" was perfectly situated for us, a large appartment with 6 bedrooms on 3rd floor (lift). Easy walking distance to many of the best locations. Judy was most helpful with advice on buses, metros etc. All the staff were very pleasant. Breakfasts were very good for this type of accommodation and the rooms immaculate with all we needed. Our room was at the back which was quiet. We valued the independence afforded by the swipe keys for entry etc. We shall return...sooner, rather than later. Patricia and Beryl, sisters from Yorkshire.

Reviews.Title: “Creepy...avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerMoscow
Reviews.Content: MERULANA INN, ROME. Hotel Management of the future? He can see you but you can't see him! Found online. Don't be fooled by the photos. We booked online using Hotel Club "Rates to Go". 170 Euros per night. The hotel is difficult to find, mainly because this is NOT a hotel, with any discernible building or hotel staff, but part of a floor run remotely by an unknown entity with video cameras (creepy?) and one staffer who is not there most of the time. Make no mistake, this is an experimental and unethical business venture, where a Manager without a name or contact number, who you will never see (but he can see you!), runs the business remotely from a secret location using technology to abolish practically all labour costs. Don't believe that insincere welcome. At 170 Euros a night, you are paying proper hotel prices, but will not receive any hotel services. You never know who you are dealing with....They have you full personal details and you will never know their name, address or number....... We went to the third floor and were met by Ms G. One of the first things she pointed out was the remote controlled front door. If necessary the unknown Manager can usher you in and see what's going on using the cameras installed in the ceiling...She took one of our credit cards for what we thought was a room guarantee (ie, for mini-bar - but there wasn't anything in the fridge). We only found out the next morning when we asked her, that she had charged the credit card for the entire 4 night stay, even though we had only just arrived. DAY ONE, first night....We needed to take a shower, but there was NO HOT WATER. Zilch. By this time Ms G. had left the building. There is a sign suggesting a number for emergencies. Whoever answers is totally disinterested. There was nobody to take action to fix what appears to be a problem they have known about for a long time...The hotel does not have and has never had enough hot water for its guests. So we decided that we had better eat. We made a point of booking a "hotel" that says it has Wi Fi due to its obvious uses on the road. There was NO WI FI, it simply did not work. When we got back we decided to watch TV. There were 300 stations, all in Italian. Ok we're in Italy. The walls of the tiny room we were given were battered, light fittings didn't work, the plastic bath looked like it had never been cleaned and the tap was hanging off the bathroom wall with silicon gel. When we eventually did take a COLD SHOWER the bath did not drain...The shower curtain was ineffectual and the entire bathroom flooded. Again, nobody we could report this to. Oh dear... DAY TWO. We rose to a another cold shower and a breakfast room full of disgruntled customers. None of them had hot water. While the breakfast was scheduled for 8.00am, Ms G. did not arrive until 8.45am. The breakfast is delivered the previous day and is basically white bread, some packaged croissants, a fatty manufactured sausage slice, plastic cheese slices yoghurt and tinned fruit and some bright yellow scrambled eggs that had been "interfered" with. There was foul tasting luke warm instant coffee in a jug and two carafes of coloured artificial substances masquerading as fruit juice. There were 12 people in the little breakfast room (it was impossible to all sit at the tables) ..... We questioned Ms G. abut our credit card being charged in full and she made us wait for a long time while another lady, presumably related to the mystery owner, came and dealt with this. It was clear that there was some tension between Ms G. and her employer, by their raised voices. Ms G. had changed from her jeans into a black and white hotel service costume. On a solitary positive note, we managed to get a temporary refund from the mystery lady. In the end we had a COLD SHOWER and went out to see Rome, at last. We went to use the taps in the room and this time THERE WAS NO WATER AT ALL. The WATER PROBLEM and the WI FI PROBLEM dogged us for the entire 4 night stay, including DAY 3 and DAY 4. The BREAKFAST continued to be TERRIBLE, and we were made to feel UNWELCOME by Ms G. ....We also noticed that in her spare time Ms G.was asking guests to leave positive reviews of the hotel. ...We caught her writing her own reviews! tsk tsk... CHECK OUT was a DISGRACE. We had a plane to catch and we tried desperately to negotiate a satsifactory outcome regarding the room rate in view of everything that had gone wrong. It was not fair that we should pay 170 Euros per night. The mystery video manager off-site was called. He instructed the "receptionist" to ensure that we do not leave. In a farcical routine, this woman attempted to take our backpacks out of our hands, with a view to holding them until we paid. Fortunately we were able to keep hold of our things as she attempted to steal them. We needed to meet our plane, so we left immediately. Our attempts to sort out the bill had come to nil. We have never in our lives been faced with such an unprofessional outfit. THEN WE FOUND LATER THAT THE FULL AMOUNT HAD BEEN TAKEN UNAUTHORISED FROM OUR CREDIT CARD. WE COMPLAINED TO THE BANK AND THEY LAUNCHED AN INVESTIGATION. THE MONEY WAS EVENTUALLY RE-CREDITED TO OUR ACCOUNT. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED! DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL. It's a horror movie.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jvptravels
Reviews.Content: We spent the first three nights of our Italy vacation at Rome's Merulana Inn and loved it! This hotel was perfect for us, and a great introduction to Italian hospitality. Judy and the team here were wonderful. Merulana Inn is actually a bed and breakfast, located on the third floor of a residential apartment building. Like most of the places we stayed at, this Inn is discreetly located. No big signs or flashy neon lighting up the street with the name. Just a large double door (like most buildings) with a very small sign posted above a door buzzer with the name of the inn. Our room was beautiful, with a very comfortable bed, and loaded with updated features including a refrigerator, air conditioner and remote-controlled door shutters that roll down to cover the terrace doors at night. Yes, we had a small terrace outside our room. Our large bathroom was equally impressive. It featured modern equipment including a bathtub with a shower, new toilet and even a bidet. The bathroom also had a door that led to the terrace, with a manual shutter/cover. A delightful breakfast of Italian meats, cheeses, breads and croissants was served in the dining area each morning of our stay. The staff also prepared coffee and scrambled eggs with cheese and ham as well. Another great feature here was the free wireless internet service, which was very dependable. A nice modern touch was a small key card holder inside the room where you place one of your key cards, to activate the electricity in your room. This is a great way for the owners to control energy use, as you take your card with you when you leave the room for the day, and the electricity shuts off on its own. Much better than another place we stayed at where many lights and other electrical devices were on timers. Merulana Inn is located within walking distance (10 mins) of the Roma Termini train station. If you are arriving in Rome by plane, you will probably take the Leonardo Express train from the main airport to the Termini. We each had a large backpack and a small, rolling suitcase and were able to walk to the inn with no problem. There are also several cafes, gelato places, grocery stores and pharmacies in the immediate area, and of course churches. The best value in Rome is the Roma Pass. This pass gives you access to the city's Metro system for three days, as well as several museums and archaeological sites (2 free). We used this to visit the Colosseo and Foro Romano (Coliseum and Forum), as well as the Galleria Borghese. The pass only costs 25 euros, and you can purchase it online from the U.S. and pick it up when you arrive in Rome. I can't wait to visit Rome again, and will most certainly stay at Merulana Inn again, as well as recommend it to anybody who is planning to visit The Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Great !,”
Reviews.Author: Jfp91
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Rome and we are very pleased with our experience at this hotel . Location is great and price was amazing . Service was A1 , . If you arrive by air you could save some money and take the train to the hotel it is located 3 blocks away from Termini

Reviews.Title: “Amazing....we will be back for sure !!”
Reviews.Author: goldielock08
Reviews.Content: If you really want a feel of Rome, stay here ! Is Home away from Home ! The staff are Great ! Everything is so close by just a hop-skip-jump ! 10 mins to Roma Termini station,5 mins Hop-on-hop off Tour what else do you need and restaurants every corner of the street.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, Okay City”
Reviews.Author: natter1327
Reviews.Content: MERULANA INN PROS: * Good, free Wireless Internet * Decent free breakfast * Good location...Rome is so spread out that if you are too close to any one attraction, you will be extremely far from the others. Merulana Inn was about 15 - 20 minute walk from all the attractions (about 40 from Vatican). Close to Termini station also. * Clean. CONS * Nobody working at a front desk type scenario. Hotel was on the 3rd floor of a random building. If you are checking in, they will have someone there, but there isn't anyone to answer questions or to help you plan your visit, as advertised on their web site. * Elevator was so small, I was too scared to get on it! * Room was very small, though for Italy I suppose it was okay. My main problem was with Rome itself. I found it very dirty, touristy, and tacky. The ruins and Vatiican were fantastic, but the overall feel of the city was tacky and crowded. It couldn't hold a candle to other European cities I've been to, both in and out of Italy. I'm glad I went for the Colosseum, etc., but my 2 night stay was more than sufficient. I was ready to get out of there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, well situated hotel”
Reviews.Author: JPP566
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in close proximity to the main train station and is a short 10 minute walk to the colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: StefdeRoyan
Reviews.Content: This is a very good adress! Perfect location about 5 minutes walk from Termini train station where you can grab metro, trains or buses. About 15 minutes walk from the Coliseum. Rooms are very nicely decorated, very quiet. Warm welcome and very nice and helpful assistance from Judy! We'll definetely recommend this adress and will be back when we go back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Good option”
Reviews.Author: SamboAus
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Merulana Inn. Despite some of the reviews, our check in process was fine, the only catch being the lady didn't speak any english, but she was very friendly and welcoming. Our room was a good size, good bathroom, and very clean and comfortable. Good location near Termini station, although there certainly are nicer areas in Rome to stay, but it suited us quite well. I can't really believe all the bad reviews about the breakfast, we both thought it was good, better than at many other hotels, and I was never left hungry. Overall I would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in the Heart of Rome”
Reviews.Author: MikeH08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Merulana Inn after reading the reviews and deciding that we wouldn't be using the regualr hotel facilities, so the basics would suffice. The hotel did not disappoint. It wasn't hard to find as we know what we were looking for, push the buzzer and Judy the incredibly friendly and helpful lady that services the rooms and makes the breakfast let us in. She showed us a map of the area, places to see, buses to use, where to get the rome pass from, where to get lunch and how everything worked. The entry is controlled by electronic cards, which I felt provided a little more security than normal. Our room was bright, the air conditioning was working without a problem, we even had a balcony on Via Merulana which had great views up to the Basillica Mary Maggoria, from the looks of it, it was the only room with a balcony though. it had a fridge for us to put drinks in, breakfast was great fresh coffee eggs cooked differently every day and real sliced ham. Our only issues were that the bed was two singles pushed together and that the shower ran hot and cold and leaked a bit out of the side. I'd still definitely recommend it as it was the perfect base for our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location”
Reviews.Author: Bigcountry11
Reviews.Content: The entrance is off the road not very clear as to address, a bit confusing with it being in with other flats. Had to phone up to gain entry. The lift was very useful to the third floor. Once booked in this B & B is very well situated well within walking distance of most historic sites, the tour operator we used was only a 5 minuite walk away. Small and intimate on the third floor of an apartment block. Breakfast was very good. Although the air conditioning broke down and didn't get fixed during our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, chic & clean”
Reviews.Author: Mel_Peak
Reviews.Content: The Merulana Inn is in an excellent location for the price we paid being only a 10 minute walk to the colosseum / forum and approx 45 min walk through the city to the vatican. The room was modern and clean and the staff were helpful and accomodating. One of the staff members only spoke Italian so we had a real language barrier but she overcame this by demonstrating what we needed to know, ie. showing us which doors our pass would work on and where we could find information in English, etc. They also provided us with an A3 size map of the city detailing all the tourist attractions which made navigating through Rome extremely easy. There was a pc with internet access that guests were allowed to use which made checking metro routes and bus times very easy however we found no need to use these in the end as everywhere was so closely located. The room was cleaned each day to a high standard. Breakfast is available from 8 - 10am and wasn't as varied as we would have liked but still had food to appeal to all tastes such as cereal, toast, yoghurts, pastries and meat slices. I would happily stay here again if the opportunity arises to revisit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, good location, excellent staff.”
Reviews.Author: kee_lk
Reviews.Content: Rooms and beds very comfortable and clean, I found the room very warm but I do tend to like windows open and the temperature low. Location very convenient, close to the Termini and easy walk to access major sights or a metro station to take you to the Vatican. Decent breakfast included although the coffee could be improved. Rooms cleaned every day and fresh towels readily supplied. Only encountered one member of staff who seems to cover all required roles, she was extremely friendly, helpful and attentive. We had no difficulties with accessing the hotel - just follow the guidelines, simple enough. Small size of the hotel means noise can be a slight problem in the morning if your room is right by the dining area. Water did go off one night until the next morning but this was dealt with and didn't pose any further problems. I would happily recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Night Sleep and an Excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: Andrumen
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to couples looking for an economic and comfortable room. Excellent location for tourism, a few blocks from Rome Termini Station and some others to the sites of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: Nairka
Reviews.Content: The location is great for those who want to see the city. It's 4 min from Termini station. The service is good and very pleasant. But breakfast is very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Warning to Guests”
Reviews.Author: zita55
Reviews.Content: A warning to anyone staying here. To cut a long story short, it was agreed we could leave our luggage there till 3.00pm and when we rung the bell,after visiting the Vatican, to pick it up at 2.30pm no one answered. We phoned the emergency number and eventually was let in only to find there had been someone there all along who had ignored the bell. They then appeared to want us to pay extra for storing the luggage, but we had to just leave as we were about to miss our train. I dread to think what would of happened if we had to get a flight as we would of missed it. Cannot believe a hotel can have such a malicious and uncaring attitude towards its guests. Also could not see any fire escapes so surprised it is even legal.

Reviews.Title: “RUDEST "MANAGER" IN ITALY”
Reviews.Author: hardcore-G
Reviews.Content: do not go here!3 times we rang 2 get directions,the 1st time,call me back,im busy.she then carried on talking 2 someone else on other phone.2nd time didnt even let us finish and interupted us,by asking what room number we wanted 2 go through 2,even though we had not mentioned that.we were wanting directions.3rd time we had been walking round 4 over an hour with our bags on.and was greeted by,where r u,im waiting.i was shocked at her attitude.when we finally got there,i asked to speak 2 a manager,who was her apparently.so i tried 2 put my issues across,and was rudely interupted as she didnt like what i was saying,and she began shouting.she told us we can stay or go she didnt care,and we can write whatever on the reviews as again she didnt care.what sort of attitude is that to have as a "manager" i use that word loosely.my friedn then tried 2 calm the situation and said were tired we can discuss it in the morning,2 which she said no,but again in a raised voice,i will not talk about this,we had been backpacking 4 a month round italy and thought we would treat ourselfs,however it was the worst customer service i have received,should of stuck 2 the hostels.avoid

Reviews.Title: “Charged for two nights...only stayed one”
Reviews.Author: dare2b
Reviews.Content: I wish I could write a good review for this hotel, but it's parent company ripped me off and charged me for two nights, even though I only stayed one night. The hotel was very clean, large for Europe and the location, breakfast and wi-fi were great. When I got home though my credit card statement was charged twice. I tried calling to get it fixed. I tried emailing to get it fixed, but nothing. The Merulana Inn said I had to deal with Gabrinus Hotel...and they never returned any of my calls or emails. I guess it's easy to rip someone off when you they live hundreds of miles away and can't walk back in the door to demand a refund.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky but Cool”
Reviews.Author: Ami_Jai_Patel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights, it wasn't obvious to find as there wasn't a large sign, but the address, and building number were spot on, so this can't really be pointed out as a fault. Merulana Inn is a quirky little place, with only 7 rooms, it occupy's a single floor in an office block. If you want a 24hour reception and someone to pester for information this place isn't for you. The only thing keeping this place from being 5* is things like lack of a proper reception, and meeting rooms, facilities you don't need! The room was really nice, clean with modern deco, 32" Samsung LCD TV...its as good as it gets! Good location, about a 2 minute walk from the nearest underground station, about a 5 minute walk from Termini. It even has free Wi-fi, I'd definitely stay here again and recommend it. However, i think its important for the one person that is on reception to at least understand or speak a little English. The only shame of it was, i did mention it was an anniversary trip for my husband and I and it was also his birthday, for which no effort was even made to do anything special for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation in Rome - close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: randilynng
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a total of 3 nights during our 12 night "tour of Italy" and we were very pleased with the accomodations and service we received. The room was excellent for the price and location - cheaper than many others in the area and nicer than most rooms. Rooms were clean and tidy, and nicely decorated. Toiletries provided, and fresh towels each day if you would like. We stayed in room 4 and it had a balcony with a wonderful view of the piazza down the street. We didn't use the safe as that is an extra charge. Breakfast served every day - Sunday hot breakfast including scrambled eggs which is much more than most hotels which serve only the equivalent to a continental breakfast. The staff was very accomodating as we arrived earlier than checkin and they held our bags so we could walk around the city until our room was ready. Computer access in the common area was very convenient for emails, making additional travel plans/reservations etc, and was free of charge. If you are traveling with more than one person, suggest getting two room keys as one is required to turn on all electricity in the room. My husband wanted run out for a quick errand and left me with out power - when we returned for our last night of our stay in Italy, we simply asked for an additional key and it was no problem. The only drawback to this hotel - which is VERY minimal - is that it is on the 3rd floor of a residential building, and there is no elevator so we had to carry our bags up the stairs. Not a problem for us, but for older travelers or those with physical limitations it could be an issue. Also, because it is in a residential building you will need to be buzzed in the front door. The staff is only at the inn from 8:30am until between 2 and 3pm so if you arrive after that you will need to buzz the webcam to contact the affiliate hotel location and they will buzz you into the building and then into the inn itself. Both times, we arrived when the staff was onsite, so we didn't have a problem. This was an excellent hotel in a perfect location - about 10 min walk to the Colosseum, and 20 - 25 min walk to Spanish Steps. We took a taxi to the Vatican and it only cost 15 euros. Merulana is about 5 blocks from Termini Station, which we easily walked to and from with our suitcases in tow, and it's very easy to navigate with a map. Would recommend to anyone looking for a nice hotel at a very reasonable price, in a prime location for site seeing in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for sightseeing Rome and for the relax!”
Reviews.Author: MerulanaInn
Reviews.Content: Firstly, forgive me my English. I’m not a native speaker. I spent couple of nights in this... Yes, it is some problem to call this place, because it isn't a regular hotel with 24-hour reception desk and staff and with a big neon sign with its name on the building's wall. You shouldn’t expect all these things. It may makes you a deep confusion when you will arrive on Via Merulana 19. It is because I would like to start my opinion from writing some “instruction <<How to use it>>” for the very first time guests. It is a type of "bed and breakfast" (Guest House), but without a doubt it has a 3-star hotel standard. And it’s located in the regular, dark brown-color, beautiful apartment building. To get inside (after 15:00 hour) you have to have your own cell phone to dial the number you can see on the small table on the wall, just on the left side of the big wood door. The person on the phone will inform you what you should do, give you your room number and open the door for you (you will hear a buzz, so push the door to get inside; remember, after 15:00 hour there is no personal assistance for you!). Next, you have to take a lift and go up to 3rd floor, when you can see the door to our Inn. After that, owner should open this door for you (still full automatically, remote, no person assist or invite you). After all these things the rest should be simple: you have to find your room (there is just few of them inside, so it will takes you max. ab.2 minutes). You have to check the open-box close to the door to find an information inside with your name and white magnetic card, which you use to open your room door, the door on the street and the door on the 3rd floor, when you get inside the building. The rest you will learn after reading the information sheet. All these information above may decrease you confusion and stress after arriving, if you have no idea there is no a regular hotel. Personally me and many other guests were convinced that we reserved “normal” 3-star hotel and what was our surprise on the place… OK. It was very important for all guests being there for the first time. Now, I would like to add my private opinion about this place as a tourist. Position in the city of “Merulana Inn” is absolutely georgeous! First, it takes just 10-min. walk from Roma Termini Station to Via Merulana 19. You have every most important monuments and parks just around you (Colosseo and Foro Romano is ca. 20-30 min. walk through the beautiful Parco di Traiano, to access Fontana di Trevi takes ca. 30-40 min. walk, same time you need to reach Piazza di Spania, in the next 15 min. you can reach Piazza del Popolo and a lot other interesting places. The rooms are very clean and comfortable (with air-conditioning, mini-bar, tv, safe, map of the center of Rome, phone), bed are superb, and of course bathroom is clean and very good equipped (big shower cabin, hair dryer, tissues, basic cosmetics). Just all you can expect from 3-star hotel. Even “Merulana Inn” is placed in the center of the city, I can say it is quiet place inside (any silence may disturb just some other unruly guests). Breakfasts are OK and enough for the next 2-3 hours sightseeing (I’m still hungry, so maybe breakfast will enough for a longer time for other guests). Everyday from 6 in the morning to 3 in the afternoon (if I remember it correctly) you can meet VERY, VERY KIND AND HELPFUL PERSON, A GOOD “SPIRIT” OF “Merulana Inn” named MISS JUDY! You can always count on her help, whatever regarding your room and Guest House or even your own sightseeing plans. JUDY! I KINDLY THANK YOU PERSONALLY FOR YOUR HELP AND FOR EVEN SIMPLE CONVERSATIONS! KISS YOUR HAND, MADAME! If I will plan another visit in Rome, I will choose again stay in “Merulana Inn”without no doubt! You can thrust every positive opinion about this place! Piotr

Reviews.Title: “Believe all the positive reviews, it's exceptional”
Reviews.Author: slipperm
Reviews.Content: This is the loveliest hotel that I spent my holidays It is small for a hotel, 7 rooms: quiet and elegant. There is always someone to answer the door from 8 am to 3 pm The rooms are exquisite and comfortable, Mrs Judy from staff is very friendly. The food is ok . My family thought the hotel was perfect in every way. The hotel is well located in a near the santa maria church just a short walk to downtown The bedrooms and bathrooms are extremely comfortable, nice and clean. The bedrooms have hardwood floors, high ceilings and big windows. The beds are nice and hard, but in the best way. I slept extremely well, which for me is rare. I made our reservation directly with the hotel via email; they were very helpful and responsive. I cannot imagine a nicer place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: TREK9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights in November. The Inn lived up to its Tripadvisor reputation. The rooms are moderately sized and of a modern hotel standard. Hygiene is of a very high standard. Everything worked as it should. The housekeeper 'Judy' was very friendly and helpful. Yes, it is a little difficult to find if you are not aware of the small signage at the entrance but we had been tipped off by Tripadvisor, Thanks. Breakfast was included and was more than adequate. There's so much to do and see in Rome that your Hotel room in just a place to lay your head, I wouldn't waste my money on a more expensive hotel with lots of facilities, i don't know when you would get the opportunity to use them. Location is slightly out of centre but very close to the Central Station. All the sights are within a moderate walking distance, just plan your route properly and wear good walking shoes!

Reviews.Title: “Great, trendy, relaxing hotel in handy location for sights of Rome”
Reviews.Author: mrjinksy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in November and loved our stay. The rooms are a perfect size, bathroom with great tub- lovely to relax in after a long days walk around the city. Breakfast was what you'd expect in Europe- toast, cakes, cereal, eggs and cold meats. There was a free pc with internet access to use also. Three nights out of 4 we walked the 10 mins to the colusseum to an area with lots of lovely restaurants, All frequented by locals- good sign! The termini station was a 5 min walk away with trains and buses to all the major sights in the city...although they are all within 20/30 mins walking distance anyway. Great trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - awesome room”
Reviews.Author: dandj58
Reviews.Content: Given the price we were extremely pleased with our stay. The room was large by European standards, modern, and clean. The breakfast was adequate; and it would be very difficult to beat the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, needs a better entry system”
Reviews.Author: barnythedon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Merulana Inn for two nights at the end of a long Italian holiday. When we arrived at the address we found that it was not a traditional hotel in the sense of having a ground level reception etc, it is in fact a managed apartment. That is, in order to get in you need to ring a buzzer which connects with some chap who presumably is sat at home - who then lets you in remotely. Unfortunately this does not seem to work (which was backed up with conversations with other guests) - the only way to get in is to ring the number on the sign - twice - once to get in the main door at street level and a second time to get into the automatic door on the third floor. However, this aside (which is a little off putting), the hotel is excellent. Very modern, clean rooms, friendly staff (who are there only in the mornings for breakfast), free wifi, LCD TV, free computer etc etc. It is also pretty good value, much cheaper than similar spec hotels. You just have to put up with the initial task of getting in, and need to accept that there won't be any staff around for the majority of the time, should you have a late night desire for a club sandwich or the like!

Reviews.Title: “Merulana Inn- A fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Holidaygirly
Reviews.Content: This has to be the best hotel room for a short stay we've ever stayed in, either in the UK or abroad in other cities. It really is unique. Situated on the 3rd floor of a building only 10 minutes walk from termini station, swipe entrance doors enable you to come and go as you please with your room card once checked in. There are only 7 rooms, and it felt more like an apartment than a hotel as there is no reception as such. The bathroom is emaculate and everything seemed to be really new. The bed was very comfy and there was little to no noise from the street even thought it is on a pretty busy road. The breakfast was perfectly adequate for what we required. They had chocolate croissants, cereals, toast and jam, yoghurt, fruit juice and even jam tart! The only fault i found with this accomodation is the fact that from the outside it is not obvious that it is there! There is a small sign next to the buzzer but other than that it just looks like all the other buildings on the street. We walked straight past when we first arrived! But stay here and you are guaranteed a comfortable hassle free stay in a truly lovely hotel that is quite good value for money for a capital city.

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault it!”
Reviews.Author: pippaloou
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights and absolutely loved it! The hotel itself is only one floor of the entire building, so it's very small but this adds to its charm,as does the modern decor. Rooms aren't amazingly big, but they definitely aren't too small either, and they are equipped with everything you need (tea/coffee making facilities, good sized flat-screen tv) as well as being modern, very comfortable and clean. And the bathrooms, although fairly small, are absolutely spotless!! Breakfast, as has been said before, is basic, but there is still plenty to fill up on and the continental buffet is constantly being refilled before items run out. The hotel is run from another building, but is looked after during the morning/early afternoon by an attendant. Although she speaks very little English, she is very friendly and made a big effort with us. As the hotel is not manned all the time it means if you arrive late there may not be anyone in the building to let you in, however this isn't a problem. We arrived in the evening, but just called the phone number on hotel sign outside the main door and were promptly let into the building remotely. The hotel is in a fantastic location, very close to Termini station, walking distance from the main attractions (eg. Colosseum, Trevi Fountain) and the beautiful Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore at the end of the street. Will definitely be staying here on my next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A Hiden Gem For The Idependent Traveler”
Reviews.Author: Lilyloo07
Reviews.Content: After searching for quite some time I found the Merulana Inn. Taking into consideration that Rome accommodation is on the pricey side the Merulana seemed to be good value. The hotel is easy to find from the station and only a few minutes walk (just look out for the purple wall plaque). The entry is not conventional as the door is activated remotely at a sister hotel. After a quick call to the sister hotel we were let in. At this point I think my boyfriend thought 'where the hell has she brought me' as the hall way and staircase is a little drab and office bocky. Then the door opened to the hotel. I then got the thumbs up from an impressed boyfriend who described the hotel as 'the best hotel we have stayed in so far'! This hotel is clean, modern and value for money. Its serviced by a lovely woman in the morning who serves breakfast and cleans. This hotel is a steal only because it is not manned otherwise i think it would be in the higher price bracket, if you are more of an independent traveller looking for top quality accommodation then this is the hotel for you. Pros: Clean, Modern decor, good value for Rome prices and breakfast included Cons: On arrival the water was off, called sister hotel to report and got a man who really didn't care, no apology or compensation. After a bit of a disgruntled 1st night this was all forgotten when spoke to house keeper in morning just because she was so nice! Tips: ask for a cappuccino at breakfast, much better than the bog standard coffee served. Don't use the cake shop on the square unless you want to pay £7 a slice! Visit the Vatican on a Wednesday the Pope makes a personal apperance for his weekly service.

Reviews.Title: “Small and conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: AlbertandJudy
Reviews.Content: As agreed with the previous reviews, the hotel is a very small hotel which is really run from its parent hotel - and so everything is monitored and run via the cameras planted in every corner of the hotel. The rooms are very clean and modern with the television being equipped with great channels. The lady who watches the place (Faye (sp?)) makes the breakfast in the morning and cleans every room in the hotel; and she does a wonderful job. However after 3pm she is gone from the hotel and back to the parent hotel to take care of those rooms. The hotel is very well located near Roma termini and we did all of rome by foot i.e. Colosseum, spanish steps, vatican city. A few bad points about the hotel is the ancient elevator which seems to struggle going up and down particularly if you have heavy luggage. Although breakfast is provided alot of the food that is made has come from preserved packages (particularly the fruit), the oj is just orange syrup. Apart from those minor things, the hotel was very good and very conveniently located in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Merulana - Realistic Review”
Reviews.Author: KingLear
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Merulana. As noted by others, it is an odd little hotel/B+B. There is an attendant on duty every day from about 7:30 am to 3 pm. She sets the breakfast in the morning and then proceeds to clean all the rooms herself. We had the inn book a car for us from and to the airport. It was 60 euros each direction. Expensive perhaps, but probably not much more than a taxi - with the added benefit of the driver knowing exactly where to take us and the inn knowing exactly when we were arriving. I highly recommend emailing them after booking your room and arranging a pick-up. Just to illustrate how helpful that service was, my luggage didn't arrive in Rome when we did. I had to wait in a baggage office line for 90 minutes, with no way of informing the driver that we actually had arrived. We fully expected him to be gone by the time we exited the baggage area, but he was still there waiting for us. (My bag arrived at the inn the next morning.) The hotel belongs to another hotel nearby, which is listed in the folder that will be waiting outside your room when you arrive. Some other travelers have stated that the phones don't work - they do, you just have to know how to dial. Keep at it - you'll get it (dial two 0's before the 6, even though you might think you have to dial just one). There is no reception, just a cold marble entrance behind a big wood door. The building contains businesses - it's an office building, not an apartment block. Only the 3rd floor is a hotel. You'll likely not see anyone else there. The elevator is ridiculously small and ancient. Please remember to shut all doors when you exit the elevator, otherwise no one will be able to call it from other floors. Breakfast is terrible. The juices are all made from powder (the red liquid is NOT tomato juice, but rather a powdered berry juice). There are cold cuts and cheese, a syrupy fruit cocktail and a couple of types of cereal. You can also make toast in the world's slowest toaster. The coffee is horrible, so ask the attendant for a cappuccino instead. She's very helpful and happy to make it. Ten times better than the instant coffee in the Thermos jug. There are only 5 tables (seating 2 each) in the extremely small and narrow breakfast room. It really wasn't terribly busy, so we had no problem finding space (family of 4). Now on to the good stuff. The rooms are clean and modern. They have great HDTVs, but there aren't any English channels. Thankfully, the Beijing Olympics were on when we stayed there, so not much English translation was needed. There isn't a lounge, or a bar or anything. If you're a night owl like myself, you'll have to go elsewhere or give in and just go to bed early. The aforementioned attendant (a very nice young lady at the time of our stay) could not have been more helpful, but, as stated above, she was gone by 3 pm. At that point, big brother in the mothership hotel a few blocks away was watching on all the carefully placed cameras. No matter when you arrive, you'll be let in remotely - either by the attendant from the 3rd floor, or a clerk in the hotel a few blocks away. You just have to use the intercom and all should work out. If the attendant is gone when you check in, your room keycard will be posted outside your door. After that, you'll have your keycard and will be able to let yourself in downstairs and on the 3rd floor whenever you like. In the area - stay away from the restaurant directly across from the big church (Santa Maria Maggiore - read about it on Wikipedia - it's remarkably important) just around the corner from the Merulana on Via Carlo Alberto. The menu is great, the food was really good, but the prices are stupid. Instead, there is a great little unheralded restaurant the other direction down Via Merulana. It's called Tempio di Mecenate and it's located at Lago Leopardi 14-18 (close to about #60 Via Merulana or so - on a small side plaza next to Panne d 'Arte - a fabulous bakery). Tel. 06 4872653 - although you won't need reservations. They have an extensive Sardinian menu. The service is excellent and the prices are great. We found it completely by chance and ate there three times during our six day stay. (Note - the stupidly expensive restaurant is open from 5 am until 2 am, so it has that going for it, whereas Tempio di Mecenate may only be open for lunch and dinner.) There is another good restaurant almost right across the street from the Merulana (half a block away facing away from the church). It's called Scoglio Di Frisio (256 Via Merulana) and serves mainly seafood and pasta. It's an ancient, family run restaurant that's kind of cheesy (grotto theme, guy strolling around the restaurant singing cliched Italian songs like O Sole Mio and Volare - but he has a great voice and brought my wife to tears). The sole is about the best I've ever had anywhere, anytime. The lowdown - would I stay there again? Probably, but I'd keep my expectations realistic. We paid 160 euros a night for the family "suite" (basically two adjoining rooms). That's a pretty extraordinary price in Rome for two rooms. To get the same in a more traditional, fully-featured hotel would have cost twice as much. If you don't expect more than a simple, clean room and a simple, unappetizing breakfast, at an extremely reasonable price, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “poor management”
Reviews.Author: Mostlyhappy
Reviews.Content: We booked and paid for a family room--2 adjoining rooms, as we were traveling with our children--but were given 2 rooms at opposite ends of the hotel because someone else wished to extend their stay. This posed some real inconvenience for us and we were not happy with how the hotel handled the situation. Also, the phones didn't work at all, the showers consisted of dribbling water, and there's no staff on site after 6 p.m, which means we had to deal with late arrivals wanting admittance to the hotel. It's attractive, and clean, but we were overall very disappointed by the management of our reservation and the lack of response to our concerns re the phones etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angebange
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of March. It is a very small hotel, taking up one floor of an apartment block. It is very new and spotlessly clean. The power shower was fabulous! The location was also a very easy walk from everywhere. We only had one issue with the hotel, and that was that our towels were taken to be washed and not replaced. As the hotel doesn't have a reception (you have to contact the reception of their sister hotel close by) it took a few hours to have this issue sorted out.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little place. Right in the heart Of Rome”
Reviews.Author: Gaze79
Reviews.Content: I've not long been back from this strange little hotel. It’s hidden away in what is really a small apartment block with each floor belonging to different companies, don’t let this put you off though it has its own secure entrance hall on its floor and cameras along all the main areas. These aren't as obtrusive as other guests have made them out to be, I wouldn’t have noticed them if I hadn’t read other reviews on this site before going, and id imagine anyone else who has worked in a busy office environment wouldn’t notice them either. I’m sure these are just a precaution in such a small hotel which isn’t staffed all day. The rooms are lovely and far better then I had expected in Rome, they are both clean and in beautiful modern condition. I do admit the showers are a bit sparse on hot water, but they are warm enough to shower in comfortably. Our balcony didn’t offer much of a view, but its nice to have it open and have some breeze going through. The breakfasts were of the traditional Rome variety, which means very bitter juices a cake, toast and a selection of cold meat and porridge type dishes, this was a little odd to me but "When in Rome ...". The lady who helps with breakfast and cleans the rooms couldn’t be more helpful with good English and a very happy outlook she gives you a very welcome greeting each morning. She was also accommodating allowing us to leave our luggage inside the secure complex for the entire day on our day of departure. Then there is the hotels shining feature, its location. Being almost right next to (although not close enough to hear) the termini (train station) you’re right in the heart of Rome , with almost every tourist sight within walking distance. I think we saw everything we went to see and didn’t have to get a single bus/taxi for the entire time. This includes the across town trek to the Vatican which with the map supplied by the hotel was superb, as the map gives all the road names as well as graphical representations of tourist attractions, which is a big bonus in a foreign city and means you don’t have to go far to see something and really helps you make the most of any trip. I'd certainly come to Rome again, and id stay here again without a doubt. It’s a lovely clean hotel in the heart of Rome where you want to be, what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: Nataleigh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very tastefully decorated, and very clean. Two positive points that you note as soon as you walk in. The reason I have rated this stay so badly is because of a trail of events mainly with the service... First of all, we had no hot water in our bathroom in the first night. We spoke to the lady who is in charge of breakfast and she called the management. Management arrived and said they would look into it. At the same time we also explained that the safe did not work. The next day our hot water was fixed so we were happy with the level of service. On our second evening, we came back to a note in our room saying please can you change rooms before the morning. We then had to move all of our gear and settle into a new room. No thank you, or apology for in-convenience. The next morning we had the same problem with no hot water and the heater in the bathroom would not work. Unfortunately the breakfast lady was not there so we had to call a number that they provide if you have any problems. This number was absolutely useless! It's a way for the hotel to hide away from any problems without facing you. We called numerous times, and we either got hung up on, or they said they were doing something about the hot water / heater and never did. After four nights, nothing further was resolved and we never heard back from them! We wanted to call the number to get suggestions for good local restaurants, but again, they either didn't answer or could not help. There is no wireless internet here from the bedrooms. You can get it if you stand in the hallway right next to the main computer. Because this hotel is so small, this really wasn't good enough. Overall, this hotel is obviously very new and their teething problems are far away from being resolved. They are trying to be cheap and have no-one on site, but this really proved to be a problem for us. I will not be going back to the Merulana Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “nice nice ---except big brother”
Reviews.Author: lifeisadream
Reviews.Content: very nice little place...and looking at other places in rome it was definitely good value for money...rooms beautiful with everything needed....heating was provided via aircondicioning system....overall very cool...the only thing we could not get used to are all the cameras placed in the corridors...made you feel being watched all the time and there are already enough cameras on the streets of rome...other than that I would certainly recommend the place and the city of rome....AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Super Little Place”
Reviews.Author: LondonUschi
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Rome on the 29th Feb. and stayed at the Merulana Inn for 3 nights. Being a bit of a "Snob", this has actually been the first time I have ever stayed in a B&B rather than a 4* Hotel. And to my own surprise, I absolutely LOVED it !!! Modern decor, comfortable big bed, lovely bathroom and spotlessly CLEAN. Here is a little bit of guidance for when you first arrive at the Merulana Inn: Should you arrive late afternoon as we did, ring the bell at the main door and it will open to allow access into a large hallway. At the end of the hall you'll find a rather nice oval stairwell and a sweet little lift. Now, despite fellow reviewers questioning the functionality of the lift we deceided to chance it ......and yes, IT DOES WORK. Just press the red "C" button to call the lift. Admittingly there's only room for 2 people, but once you're in you'll actually enjoy the ride up to the 3rd floor. We certainly did. To gain access from the 3rd floor landing into the actual accommodation, press the button to your left on the wall and the door open's automatically. You'll probably find that there's no one at reception to check you in ..... don't panic - it's all pretty well organised. There is a list of expected arrivals next to the key board on the desk. You'll find your name and allocated room number on that list. Proceed to your room and you'll find a welcome pack with your key card in a wall rack ,outside your room. Let yourself in and enjoy !! You can check in properly at breakfast the next morning. We would like to give A BIG THANK YOU to the wonderful housekeeper ( unfortunately we didn't get her name ) who was on breakfast / housekeeping duty during our stay ....she really looked after us !!! The breakfast buffet was constantly replenished, she cleaned our room every morning, to the highest standard - fresh towels, bed linen, topped up "in room" tea / coffee making facilities etc.and was extremely helpful, always with a smile. (also, I wish my Italian was as good as her english ) Finally, the Merulana Inn is a credit to the owners / management who obviously take pride in ensuring that guests truly enjoy their stay in Rome ! We will definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mulholml
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with husband, parents and my brother. Went through the hotels own website which did work out a little cheaper. Good email contact with the hotel before we left for Rome. The only thing is that on the website the address is shown as 46, it is not it's number 19. Rooms on the 3rd floor so 3 flights of stairs. There was a lift but we never tried this. No reception but cardkeys and info are outside your room on arrival. The Inn itself is beautifully deorated with a wonderful smell of 'newness'. The rooms have all you require for your stay. Beds are firm and very comfy, pillows are large and soft. The room has heat and AC, windows open fully and my parents had a room with a balcony so useful for the smokers. En-suite is large enough with shower only, towel heater which made this room very warm ant the shower itself was excellent. Flat screen tv, but ony english speaking channel was MTV, although not much tv was watched as you don't want to miss a second of Rome. Tea and coffee making facilities and mini bar which was reasonably priced. Breakfast was typical hams, cheese,etc but very tasty and this is the only time you will see an employee. You will not be dissapointed with this hotel with lots of friendly bars and cafes in the vacinity. Irish bar was across the road that serves generous helpings of JD compared to cola and was cheaper than italian bars. I hope this helps and enjoy, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Surprise”
Reviews.Author: FabFab
Reviews.Content: This hotel had only been open a few weeks when we stayed there so everything was shiny and new! Very nicely furnished with gorgeous colour schemes. Comfortable beds and modern bathroom (with good pressure!). Breakfast was typically European but nothing to complain about. Location was fantastic, right outside Santa Maria Maggiore and only a few mins walk to the Metro. Would not overlook this hotel just because it's not highly rated or well known. Well worth the money.
